$95 million donated to Red Cross Bushfire fund BUT “some of the funds would be saved to spend towards disasters in the future“. People didn’t donate so the Red Cross could bank. There are people living in tents who’ve lost homes and whole communities in distress. Spend the money.

Who knew, when donating to the #RedCross for the #bushfires that they had never "committed" to pass it all on and did not intend to? Concurrently they still have not repaid $20m of their staff wages underpayments discovered and announced in mid 2018.
WE WERE CONNED! #NeverAgain

The Australian Red Cross owed $20m to current and former employees, is still paying this back, and hasn't joined the National Redress Scheme for child abuse survivors. When I asked, they said they are reconsidering. #bushfires https://t.co/LnMMRgEr63 https://t.co/UqGPIb6zPG

Our Bushfire Advisory Panel met this week. From Monday we'll start distributing new financial assistance. This weekend we're getting systems and teams ready to make it as easy as possible for ppl to access this additional help. https://t.co/isB82aPj3l

My concern about where all these funds are going from the Fire Concert performed in Sydney is;

Funds raised will be split between the RFS, RSPCA, and Mr Dutton's Red Cross Disaster Relief Fund and Management...the latter is as I understand it a Fund set up for future disasters.

Nearly $5m raised by the tennis community for bushfire relief. Thank you for your donations, let’s keep the ball rolling. 

https://t.co/jidzZJXhRt

To show their solidarity with their #RedCross family in #Australia, Red Cross teams across the #Pacific have been raising funds to support @RedCrossAU as they help those affected by the #bushfires https://t.co/dKt7dIvqgt

Tonight myself, @PhamTheBanana and this AMAZING community raised $5,680.96 for the @RedCrossAU getting the total raised for the #DestinyFANZ Bushfire Appeal well over $20,000! Special thanks to @SteelSeriesANZ @SteelSeries for sponsoring the charity event! We sent the stream over

❤️ The compassion of @RedCrossAU volunteers goes beyond humans. As #bushfires in #Australia continue to burn through a reported 10 million hectares, volunteers keep supporting communities and spreading the love. Thanks for what you do 🙏 https://t.co/KOkUv6VgMi

The first ever AFLW derby btwn the Eagles and Dockers will also raise money for bushfire relief. Tix just $3, all proceeds to Red Cross. Pre-sale tickets available from tomorrow. Optus Stadium, Sat Feb 15. https://t.co/ziVXquW03A #perthnews

The worst kind of irresponsible reporting. When $10m goes to critical infrastructure and processing of donations you don’t headline that as “$10 million will not go to the cause.“ “Red Cross director admits $10MILLION will not go to bushfire victims” https://t.co/B7hOyDNLF8

Red Cross director admits $10MILLION will not go to bushfire victims https://t.co/dL6GaAt76b BS article. If you want to piss away the whole $115 m then just give it all away today without any checks or balances. The public expects more than that.  Controls/systems cost money

The Australian Red Cross says more than $61 million will be available for immediate relief as the charity doubles its funding for bushfire victims in the wake of criticism over slow donation distribution.

Red Cross Society of China sent work group to #Wuhan to probe on controversy concerning Wuhan Red Cross allegedly held up donations of medical supplies and delayed distribution to local hospitals, and the society vows to implement a full-fledge rectification. #NCP https://t.co/XjnRlVQbG1

After the Red Cross copped alot of criticism for how it was spending bushfire donations Tim Costello has shed light on how charities operate.

This week’s update from our bushfire relief and recovery teams around the country:
➡️ In Vic providing support at relief/recovery centres in #Mallacoota, #Bairnsdale and #Corryong
➡️ Telephone outreach to people referred by Agriculture Victoria, police and field volunteers

1/5 https://t.co/2Ub6N20AtX

Our Register.Find.Reunite service has been stood down for the first time since Sept. We’ve registered 68.4k people mostly at evacuation + relief centres during bushfires, floods & a tropical cyclone. 

It’ll be back up for the next emergency – for now, we’re enjoying the quiet. https://t.co/vclHVsilqL
